news.title: Quarter of police forces lack basic policies on sexual offences, Sarah Everard report finds
news.summary: The report, four years after the 33-year-old's murder, says urgent action is needed to prevent violent, sexual attacks against women.

news.title: Jury trials scrapped for crimes with sentences of less than three years
news.summary: The reforms are being brought in to tackle unprecedented delays in the Crown Court.

news.title: Reeves did not mislead on challenges facing UK ahead of Budget, says OBR official
news.summary: Prof David Miles tells MPs the messaging given by the chancellor was "not inconsistent" with the situation she faced.

news.title: Hegseth authorised Venezuelan boat strikes but admiral ordered second hit, White House says
news.summary: The strikes, authorised by Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth, have raised fresh legality questions - but the White House says laws have been followed.

news.title: Our teen daughter died from meningitis - we didn't know a booster jab would have saved her
news.summary: Meg Draper was enjoying the social side of student life - within weeks she had died from meningitis.

news.title: Twelve more prisoners released in error, with two still missing, says Lammy
news.summary: The releases happened in the past three weeks, coming on top of 91 prisoners who were freed by mistake between April and October.

news.title: Former England cricketer Robin Smith dies aged 62
news.summary: Robin Smith was a key figure in the England side in the late 1980s and 1990s.

news.title: Tax rises and tighter spending to hold back UK growth, new report warns
news.summary: Growth in the UK economy is expected to slow next year, an influential global policy group predicts.

news.title: Sound of 2026: 10 acts you'll be obsessed with next year
news.summary: The list tips new music for the coming year, following previous winners like Adele, Haim and Chappell Roan.

news.title: Devastating toxic spill seen as test of whether African countries will stand up to China
news.summary: Chinese companies provide jobs and much needed revenue in Zambia, where the disaster took place.
